description:
135 North Willard Street is a 5,155 square foot multifamily property situated on a 2,500 square foot lot in San Francisco’s highly desirable Lone Mountain neighborhood. Built in 1963, the property consists of six (6) units with a diverse unit mix: one (1) - 1 BD / 1 BA unit, four (4) - 2 BD / 1 BA units, and one (1) - 3 BD / 1.5 BA unit, along with six (6) - parking spaces. Several units have been remodeled, featuring carpeted flooring, granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, and double-paned windows, while all units benefit from abundant natural light and spacious layouts. The property also offers shared laundry facilities and is separately metered for gas and electricity.

Lone Mountain is one of San Francisco’s quietest neighborhoods, offering a balance of serenity and urban sophistication. Residents enjoy tree-lined streets, eclectic cafes, excellent dining on Balboa & Clement Streets, nightlife, and easy access to Golden Gate Park (within 2 blocks), USF, Alamo Square, and downtown San Francisco. Its centralized location, cultural vibrancy, and lifestyle amenities make it one of the city’s most coveted enclaves.

135 N Willard Street is a rare opportunity to acquire a classic, well-maintained multifamily asset in the heart of Lone Mountain, combining historic character with modern upgrades and enduring investment appeal.

description:
Urban Group Real Estate, as exclusive agents, is pleased to present 1501 Howard Street in San Francisco for purchase. This commercial flex space building totals approximately 7,905 square feet and is ideally situated in San Francisco’s South of Market neighborhood. 

The property features 5,883 SF of ground-floor warehouse and flex space with a 10' roll-up door and 11'–20' clear height, along with 2,022 SF of second-floor office including two conference rooms, private offices, a kitchenette, and restrooms. 

Equipped with 400 amps / 3-phase power, the building supports a wide range of light industrial, creative, and production uses. 

With excellent access to Hwy 101, I-80, public transit, Downtown, and Mission Bay, 1501 Howard offers full-building identity, an adaptable layout, and strong infrastructure—an ideal opportunity for owner-users and investors seeking well-located flex/industrial property in San Francisco.

description:
The NAI Northern California team is excited to present a unique investment opportunity: a three-property portfolio featuring 851 Irwin Street, The Solano Professional Building, and The Redstone Building, all located in the dynamic Bay Area. 
      
These properties have recently undergone significant capital improvements, including system upgrades, interior modernizations, enhanced security measures, and exterior revitalizations. Each building boasts full occupancy, offering a prime chance to capitalize on potential rent growth.
     
851 Irwin Street is a 29,923-square-foot, three-story office building situated in the heart of San Rafael. The property offers 59 on-site parking spaces and excellent visibility with frontage along Irwin Street.
     
The Solano Professional Building, located at 1760 Solano Avenue, is a three-story, 18,819-square-foot building in North Berkeley. The mixed-use asset features a ground-floor retail suite and 18 professionally renovated office suites above, supported by 19 gated parking spaces. 
     
The Redstone Building (San Francisco Landmark No. 238), located at 2940 16th Street, is a fully leased, four-story, 55,560-square-foot office and creative use property in the Mission District. Built in 1914 with a 1939 addition, the building combines historic brick masonry and concrete facades with extensive modern renovations.
     
All properties are strategically located around the San Francisco Bay, offering excellent access to major throughfares, including Interstates 580, 80, and 280, as well as Highway 101. These properties are within walking distance of local amenities, popular retailers, and restaurants. These portfolio assets are in urban, affluent neighborhoods, where the average household income exceeds $90,000 per year. Together, this portfolio presents an exceptional blend of historic character, modern upgrades, strong occupancy, and prime Bay Area locations, making it a rare and highly attractive investment opportunity.

brokerDetails.name: James Kilpatrick
brokerDetails.bio:
James Kilpatrick is the President of NAI Northern California. His career began in 1998 with a major national firm specializing in investment property brokerage where he received numerous achievement awards. He has been involved in investment transactions exceeding $1 Billion across most product categories and oversees the day to day operations, strategic expansion of the firm and large account management. 

Mr. Kilpatrick is a San Francisco Bay Area native with ownership, management, syndication and debt structuring experience across most product types. He has had various positions from board of directors appointments to President of various real estate organizations. He has also been a regular contributing writer for newsletters and trade journals of organizations such as the Berkeley Property Owners Association (BPOA) and RHA (Rental Housing Association of northern Alameda county). He is a member of the Rental Housing Owners Group (RHO), the Investment Marketing Forum (IMF) and Investment Property Marketing Group (IPMG). In addition to the above, Mr. Kilpatrick has experience in distressed asset sales, expert witness work, portfolio valuations, condominium and subdivision work, bankruptcy and trustee’s sales, sale leasebacks and other more complicated transactions.

brokerDetails.name: Seth Hubbert
brokerDetails.tagLine: Investment Advisor at NAI NorCal
brokerDetails.bio:
Seth is an Investment Advisor at NAI Northern California, specializing in transacting multifamily assets in the Bay Area. Seth has a strong leadership, analytical, and service background, providing the highest-level value to clients.

Seth has grown and led several successful businesses, including Five Iron Financial, a real estate investment firm renovating distressed property and operating housing in high-growth regions in the United States. He also previously served as the CEO of Tech Exchange, providing 45,000 computers to students and families during the height of the pandemic.

Holding degrees in Physics and Education, Seth masterfully blends quantitative analysis with client guidance and support. When not immersed in real estate, you’ll find Seth coaching youth sports, serving on community boards, and volunteering at his children’s school.

brokerDetails.name: Damon Gerstein
brokerDetails.tagLine: CRE investment professional based in Northern California.
brokerDetails.bio: Damon Gerstein specializes in office, multifamily, and industrial real estate across the Bay Area. Born and raised in Marin County, CA, Damon has spent his life immersed in the region’s unique communities and dynamic market. His local knowledge, combined with his academic background, provides clients with both insight and strategy in navigating complex transactions. Damon earned his Bachelor of Science in Urban and Regional Development with a minor in Real Estate Development from the University of Arizona. This foundation equips him with a deep understanding of market analysis, urban planning, and investment strategy—tools he leverages to deliver value to his clients. At NAI NorCal, Damon is committed to learning from industry leaders while actively contributing to the team’s success. Outside of real estate, he is passionate about traveling and sports, enjoying everything from working out and snowboarding to hiking and exploring the outdoors.

brokerDetails.name: Tim Marshall
brokerDetails.tagLine: Investment advisor with expertise in property management, operations, and client service, helping clients maximize real estate investments.
brokerDetails.bio:
Investment Advisor with a background in property management, operations, and client service. As founder of Marpensio LLC, Tim oversaw all aspects of property management including asset performance, tenant relations, leasing, and vendor coordination. Previous roles in operations and customer experience strengthened his leadership, process improvement, and client service skills.

Tim now applies this combined expertise to advising clients on commercial real estate investments. By leveraging market research and data-driven insights, he helps clients evaluate opportunities, maximize asset performance, and achieve long-term investment success with a client-first approach.

description:
1441 Bush Street is a 3,712-square-foot automotive/industrial facility located in the heart of San Francisco’s Lower Nob Hill neighborhood. The property is improved with a currently-operating auto repair shop on a month-to-month lease at $5,500 per month plus utilities. The current short term lease offers immediate in-place income with flexibility for an owner-user or future repositioning. 

Located within the RC-4 (Residential–Commercial, High Density) zoning district, the property benefits from a combination of commercial functionality and long-term redevelopment potential. The zoning allows for a wide range of uses in one of San Francisco’s most centrally connected neighborhoods.

1441 Bush Street is ideally suited for an owner-user seeking a centrally located facility—including automotive, service-oriented, light industrial, or specialty trades operators—given the hard-to-find building size, private drive-in access, and proximity to major corridors and dense customer bases. The short-term tenancy allows a buyer to secure a prime location while maintaining the option to occupy immediately or reconfigure the space to meet operational needs. 

For users evaluating occupancy costs, SBA financing can offer a compelling alternative to leasing, with monthly ownership expenses often comparable to or below market rents for similar San Francisco industrial or automotive facilities. This makes 1441 Bush Street an exceptional opportunity to establish long-term control in a supply-constrained market.

description: 1798 McAllister Street is a well-located and fully occupied mixed-use property in the heart of NOPA. The property consists of two Studio and two 1BD apartments, and a ground-floor commercial space. All five apartments were recently remodeled with high-end finishes, in-unit laundry, and modern appliances. The commercial space was just leased to a law firm on a new 10-year lease with an extension option for an additional 5 years. The commercial space is south-facing with great visibility from the street and natural light. All of the apartments are separately metered for gas and electricity, and tenants pay for their own heat. Additionally, a utility reimbursement program has been implemented to reduce all landlord utility expenses. A soft-story seismic retrofit was also completed in 2025. Located at the intersection of Baker and McAllister Streets, this is a highly desirable location that provides convenient access to Divisadero shops and retail, the Panhandle, Golden Gate Park, and Haight-Ashbury. This is an excellent opportunity to purchase a turn-key asset that will provide immediate cash flow.

description:
811 Oak Street is a turnkey and extensively renovated fourplex situated in the highly sought after Lower Haight district of San Francisco.  The property is located less than one-mile from numerous AI companies.  It has a lot size of 2,548 square feet and a massive building area of 5,725 square feet. There are two large six-bedroom/three-bathroom units consisting of 2,184 and 1,871 square feet, one five-bedroom/three-bedroom unit (1,720 square feet), one two-bedroom/one-bathroom unit (768 square feet).  Each unit has a vaulted ceiling, large kitchen and living room, and commercial quality laundry machines.

Current ownership acquired the property in 2019 from a long term owner that had completed limited upgrades. The sale represented the starting point in a multi-year construction project which would culminate with the property being transformed into best-in-class rental housing. This project consisted of a down to the studs’ renovation consisting of entirely new electrical wiring and panels, gas, copper plumbing system, exterior siding and paint, roof, and hallway finishes. The unit interiors were entirely renovated with new walls and ceilings, subfoors, plank flooring, LED lighting, plumbing fixtures, dual pane windows and doors. The high-end kitchens were appointed with quartz countertops, new cabinets, and stainless steel appliances and the bathrooms were given new vanities, bathtubs, showers, and plumbing fixtures. New wall heaters were added in addition to an in-unit washer and dryer in each unit. No expense was spared in these infrastructure and system upgrades and unit renovations. See the “Scope of Renovations” document on the following page for a complete breakdown of capital improvements on the properties. 811 Oak Street has arguably been renovated to a greater degree and higher specification than any other multifamily property of similar vintage in San Francisco. These improvements have resulted in 811 Oak Street achieving rent levels commensurate with newer construction properties in the area. 

The tenant profile at 811 Oak Street consists of very high income and credit score professionals in technology, engineering, and business; therefore, it has had 100% tenant collections and there have been no past due rents or tenant-landlord disputes. Maintenance and repairs are infrequent and low cost on an absolute basis and on a relative basis compared to other properties. Additionally, tenants pay a monthly utility fee for water, sewer, and trash.  The luxury amenities coupled with the new systems and large units have resulted in 811 Oak Street having much higher income and significantly lower operational expenses compared to other San Francisco fourplexes. Additional income is available from increasing rents to market level upon unit turnover.

The property is currently self-managed by the owners who are business professionals.  They have found the management to be straight forward and have not needed to hire a property management company, further reducing the operational expenses. Marketing of units for rent is aided by a high-?delity property website which includes professional photos, 3D Matterport virtual tours, and ?oor plans. This content will be transferred to the new owner.

San Francisco apartment rents and building values have increased significantly this year. The best-in-class renovations, management ease, proximity to large employers, and prestigious Lower Haight location make 811 Oak Street a great opportunity for both the cash-flow and appreciation minded investor.

Four of the apartments have been recently remodeled with quality finishes and modern flair while maintaining their classic Edwardian charm. A new roof was installed within the past five years. The building has newer electrical panels. Each of the remodeled units feature hardwood floors, in-unit laundry, stone countertops, and ornate tilework. Two of the five apartments have AC units, and four units have their own tankless water heaters. Some of the units have nice outlooks over the city. Tenants also are just blocks away from Dolores Park, making this a highly desirable rental location. description:
450–480 Grant Avenue, also known as 567 Pine Street, is a well-maintained three-story mixed-use corner building positioned in one of San Francisco’s most vibrant and iconic locations. Sitting at the gateway to Chinatown and just steps from the Financial District, the property offers exceptional visibility, prominent frontage, and continuous pedestrian traffic. Directly across from Saint Mary’s Square and within walking distance to Union Square, world-class shopping, renowned restaurants, hotels, and major transit lines, this prime corner setting provides an outstanding opportunity for businesses seeking a high-impact presence in a dynamic, high-demand corridor.
The building offers about 13,950 square feet of space on a 4,647 square-foot lot, featuring three ground floor retail units, three office suites on the middle level, and five renovated, modern apartments on the top floor. It also includes a large garage with three parking spaces. Currently, one retail space and one office suite are vacant. The property is zoned Chinatown Community Business (CCB), and the Assessor’s Parcel Number (APN) is 0270-016.
This offering presents an exceptional opportunity for investors to acquire a well-maintained, income-producing mixed-use asset with huge growth potential in one of San Francisco’s most dynamic and historic locations.

Located in one of the most sought after locations in San Francisco, this is a rare opportunity to purchase a property in Presidio Heights.

The vacant ground floor unit, formerly a dentist office, could be occupied by specific business uses, or could be converted to a residential unit.
The property also benefits from a very large backyard with immense potential. 
Due to the unique qualities of the property, this building is well suited for owner-occupiers as well as investors.

description:
Located directly across from Alta Plaza Park in the heart of Pacific Heights, 2690 Jackson Street presents a rare opportunity to acquire a pride-of-ownership building with flexible potential uses. Spanning approximately 4,600 square feet (per tax records), the three-story property (plus penthouse) was most recently occupied by a private high school and offers an excellent opportunity for repositioning.
The building features large classroom-style spaces with high ceilings, great natural light, and classic architectural details including crown moldings, built-in shelving, and a dramatic top-floor lounge with fireplace and exposed beam ceilings offering views of the Bay and Alcatraz. The property is configured for single-tenant use and includes a garage for 2-car parking, an elevator, and a fire sprinkler system.

Constructed in 1922, the building has been well cared for and retains much of its original character. The building features a concrete slab foundation, wood post-and-beam framing, and a flat built-up roof. Major building systems include copper plumbing, 400-amp electrical service, and a central gas-fired radiant heating system.
Delivered completely vacant, the property provides a rare opportunity for an owner-user, school, non-profit, or residential conversion buyer to reimagine the space to suit their needs. Situated at the corner of Jackson and Scott Streets, 2690 Jackson is surrounded by some of San Francisco’s most prestigious schools, residences, and parks. The property offers easy access to Sacramento Street retail, the Presidio, and major transit routes, making it one of the most desirable locations in the City.
investmentHighlights: Delivered vacant—ideal for owner-user, school, or adaptive reuse
Located directly across from Alta Plaza Park in prime Pacific Heights
Garage and on-site parking
4,602 SF three-story building plus penthouse (per tax records)
Top-floor lounge/library with fireplace, open beams, and Bay views

description:
1520 Leavenworth Street offers a rare opportunity to own a classic San Francisco apartment building in a prime Nob Hill location. With five of seven units recently renovated by the current ownership, the property is ideally positioned for investors seeking immediate in-place cash flow with additional upside potential through rent growth. Originally constructed in 1906, the building comprises approximately 4,850 square feet situated on a 1,572 square foot lot. The desirable unit mix includes five (5) two-bedroom, one-bath units, one (1) one-bedroom, one-bath unit, and one (1) studio. The property is separately metered for gas and electricity, and the earthquake retrofit has been completed, providing a strong foundation for long-term stability and operational efficiency.

Ideally located in the heart of Nob Hill, 1520 Leavenworth Street is surrounded by some of San Francisco's most sought-after residential and retail destinations. The property is within walking distance of both the Hyde Street and Polk Street retail corridors, giving residents convenient access to cafes, boutiques, dining, and daily amenities. Nob Hill is known for its historic architecture, upscale atmosphere, and central location, offering excellent connectivity to Downtown San Francisco, Russian Hill, North Beach, and Pacific Heights. The neighborhood's blend of classic San Francisco charm and urban sophistication continues to attract a high-quality tenant base, supporting consistent demand and long-term investment stability.

Strong mix of (5) 2bd/1ba, (1) 1bd/1ba, and (1) studio
Washer/dryers in most units
Further upside in rents
Large units with ample light on the top floors
Recent cap ex includes new exterior paint, updated electrical, and interior common areas

description:
1270 Bush Street and 1200 Larkin Street, also known as Bush & Larkin, is a 0.43-acre site with a 37,812-square-foot, two-story building located in the highly desirable Nob Hill neighborhood in San Francisco, California. Bush & Larkin is uniquely designed for a property in downtown San Francisco, with two large, open floor plates, each approximately 18,906 square feet per floor. 
  
Due to the slope of the road (Bush Street) abutting the property, Bush & Larkin is uniquely situated. The lower level has direct street access and existing curb cut openings along Larkin Street, with two points of ingress and egress. The upper level has direct street access, an existing curb cut opening along Bush Street, and includes one point of ingress/egress. 
      
On a macro-level, the property is strategically and centrally located within the land-constrained Bay Area, offering ample access to the surrounding area’s dense and affluent population base, with immediate access to the prominent Nob Hill and Pacific Heights neighborhoods. Within a 30-minute drive of the property, there are over 1.7 million people earning an average annual household income of over $156,000.
investmentHighlights: Bush & Larkin is an opportunity to purchase a 37,812-square-foot mixed-use commercial property, zoned Polk Street Commercial Neighborhood (NCD).
1200 Larkin Street, on the first floor, offers floor drains, large floor plates, heavy power, automated doors, and two 12- by 14-foot drive-in doors.
Second-floor at 1270 Bush Street features one 10- by 14-foot drive-in door, skylights, abundant light, and potential parking.
Property highlights include 15- to 28-foot ceiling height, ability to use full door uses, and up to 4,000 amps of 3-phase power.
Lively destination near restaurants, retailers, and grocery like Chipotle, Whole Foods, Apple Store, Target, Cheesecake Factory, and Biscuits & Blues.
Bustling Nob Hill corner position with high visibility to 28,857 cars daily, including 10,005 cars passing by on Larkin St and 18,852 on Bush St.

brokerDetails.name: Kurt Grundman
brokerDetails.bio:
Kurt Grundman is a Partner with Lockehouse Retail Group who specializes retail leasing, asset sales and site development with Lockehouse Retail Group. His career has been focused on retail tenant representation, landlord representation, property sales and development. For over a decade Kurt has prided himself on delivering consistent, excellent service to his clients. He has been fortunate enough to participate in well over a million square feet of retail real estate transactions in Northern California.

Kurt has been successful representing both local and national tenants. His specialty is developing initial market strategies for emerging concepts. Most recently he has successfully rolled out the following tenants in Northern California: Pieology, Crunch Fitness, Umami Burger, Veggie Grill, Cricket Wireless, Starbucks, Fat Noodle, Pressed Juicery, Kendra Scott and RPM45.

Through the years he has forged strong relationships with several Bay Area landlords including; Federal Realty, ROIC, City Center Realty Partners, Veritas, Regency, Kimco and Related. These relationships have been great assets when looking for off market sites or securing a location months prior to it’s vacancy.

With experience in retail, office and mixed-use projects, Kurt brings a diverse skill set to the team at Lockehouse.
Originally from Appleton, Wisconsin, Kurt studied business at St. Norbert’s College in Green Bay. He has lived in Bay area for 20 years and currently resides in San Francisco with his wife Sofia, and sons Austin and Kaleb.

brokerDetails.name: Caroline Lewis
brokerDetails.bio:
Caroline Lewis is an Associate at Lockehouse, having joined the firm in 2025. She brings a multifaceted background that spans the tech and fitness industries, with a strong foundation in sales, recruiting, leadership, and strategic planning.

Before entering the commercial real estate sector, Caroline held roles in both corporate and entrepreneurial environments, gaining valuable experience in business development, client relations, and operations management. Her earlier career in the fitness industry provided additional expertise in team leadership and wellness programming.

Caroline, originally from the Bay Area, moved to Oregon for college where she earned her Bachelor of Science in Psychology from the University of Oregon. Her love for the Bay Area brought her back, and now, with her diverse professional experience, she’s eager to build meaningful connections and deliver strategic value in the commercial real estate industry.

Outside of work, Caroline enjoys spending time outdoors with her black lab, Hank, and engages in activities like hiking, fishing, woodworking, and home-improvement projects. A former competitive bodybuilder and powerlifter, she remains passionate about fitness. Additionally, Caroline is a classically trained singer, and music continues to be an important part of her life.

brokerDetails.name: Scott Harper
brokerDetails.tagLine: Asset Management, Institutional Capital Markets, Lease Advisory, Project Leasing
brokerDetails.bio:
Scott Harper specializes in leasing office buildings in Downtown San Francisco by representing Institutional owners to maximize the value of their buildings valued between $50 million to $350 million.   
 During his career, which began in 1990 in San Francisco, he has leased, renewed, or sold approximately 12.2 million total square feet of office space in the city.  Although he primarily represents Landlords, he has also participated in $1.5 billion in investment sales transactions. Scott currently represents over 1.6 million square feet of office space with notable clients including Deutsche Asset & Wealth Management (formerly RREEF), American Assets Trust,  Prudential Investments, Principal Global Investors, GE Real Estate, Ellis Partners, Harsch Investment Properties, and Yale Properties. In 2007, Scott was appointed to start and lead the company’s West Coast Urban Landlord Partners Practice Group.  This is a specialized group of collaborative Downtown Landlord Leasing teams in Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, San Jose, Los Angeles, Orange County, San Diego, and Phoenix. Also, in 2009, Scott was asked by the company to serve on the ten member Board of Directors of Colliers International USA. Appointed the Managing Director in 2002, Scott managed the Leasing and Investment Sales operations of the San Francisco office until January 2007. During his five-year tenure as Manager of the office, revenues increased 77%.

brokerDetails.name: Brian McCarthy
brokerDetails.tagLine: Clients range from international institutional investors to local families owning single boutique office buildings
brokerDetails.bio:
Brian joined Transwestern in 2019 and focuses exclusively on San Francisco office leasing with a primary concentration on landlord representation. His clients range from international institutional investors to local families owning single boutique office buildings. Brian and his partners, Mike McCarthy and Maddie Meyersieck, work together as a team on all transactions and currently oversee a portfolio of over 30 buildings, representing over three million square feet.

Brian spent the first 15 years of his career at Colliers International where he was consistently one of the top producers in the San Francisco office. During his time at Colliers International, he was involved in over 600 transactions totaling more than seven million square feet.

brokerDetails.name: Michael McCarthy
brokerDetails.tagLine: Mike has dedicated his entire 29-year professional career to working in the San Francisco Commercial Real Estate market.
brokerDetails.bio:
Mike leads a three-person team including Brian McCarthy and Maddie Meyersieck, specializing in agency leasing in San Francisco. He takes great pride not only in his roster of clients but also in the number of years that he has been able to loyally work on their behalf. A partial list of his clients includes: SKS Investments (20 yrs.), The Swig Company (15 yrs.), PMI (13 yrs.), Hudson Pacific Properties (10 yrs.), American Assets Trust (8 yrs.), Clarion Partners (8 yrs.), Gaw Capital (8 yrs.), Zurich Alternative Asset Management (8 yrs.) and Nuveen (3 yrs.).

Mike joined Transwestern in November 2019 after a distinguished 33-year career at the San Francisco office of Colliers International. Mike was consistently a member of the Colliers Everest Club, a designation reserved for the top 10% of producers of the company. Some of Mike’s more significant lease transactions include: Adobe’s 310,584 square feet at 100 Hooper Street for Kilroy Realty Corporation, Google’s 253,198 square feet at The Landmark – One Market for American Assets Trust and Splunk’s 182,284 square feet at 270 Brannan Street for SKS Investments / Mitsui.

brokerDetails.name: Madeline Meyersieck
brokerDetails.tagLine: Vice President specializing in agency leasing.
brokerDetails.bio:
A Vice President in Transwestern’s San Francisco office, Maddie specializes in landlord representation. She focuses primarily on the SOMA and South Financial District submarkets. She and her team oversee a portfolio of more than 30 office buildings totaling more than three million square feet. Her clients include American Assets Trust, Hudson Pacific Properties and the Swig Company.   

Maddie began her real estate career in 2013 at Harvest Properties, where she served on the property management team, prior to joining Colliers as a leasing broker for the SOMA market. Her background in building operations and management provides her with a unique perspective on agency leasing, which she brings to each client engagement.

brokerDetails.name: Cassidy Zerrer
brokerDetails.tagLine: Senior Managing Director at Newmark
brokerDetails.bio: Cassidy Zerrer has been practicing commercial real estate since 2006. His wide range of experience and diverse skill set equip him to provide valuable solutions to his clients throughout the commercial real estate arena. He has advised numerous high-growth technology companies from incubation to post-IPO; on headquarters strategy and across their global portfolios. He has successfully advised a wide range of landlord clients in the leasing of existing buildings and new development throughout San Francisco.

brokerDetails.name: Richard Hayes
brokerDetails.tagLine: Richard serves as the vice presedent of McCarthy Cook, responsible for leasing
brokerDetails.bio:
Richard B. Hayes joined McCarthy Cook & Company in May, 2007 as Vice President, Leasing, Northern California. He is responsible for the leasing and marketing of the 900,000 square foot China Basin project in the Mission Bay submarket of San Francisco.
Prior to joining McCarthy Cook, Richard spent six years with Equity Office Properties leasing Class A office product in the Peninsula, East Bay, North Bay and San Jose submarkets where he completed 1,700,00 square feet of lease transactions and was involved in 1.,600,000 square feet of acquisitions and 1,500,000 square feet of dispositions. Prior to Equity Office, Richard performed corporate services at both Cushman & Wakefield and CB Richard Ellis providing services for clients such as Fritz Companies and DuPont. Richard started his real estate career as a broker in San Francisco with Colliers International. Cumulatively, Richard has completed over 5,000,000 square feet of lease transactions representing both corporate tenants and institutional real estate owners.

brokerDetails.name: Hannah Potter
brokerDetails.tagLine: Managing Director at Newmark
brokerDetails.bio: Hannah Potter joined Newmark in October 2012 where she is an active real estate advisor in the San Francisco Market. Specializing in both landlord and tenant representation, Hannah advises clients on the development and implementation of real estate strategies through all aspects of a transaction. Known for her creativity and acute attention to detail, her clients range from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies.

brokerDetails.name: Maurice Spikes
brokerDetails.tagLine: Life Sciences & Office Advisory
brokerDetails.bio: Maurice “Mo” Spikes serves as a director in Newmark’s San Francisco office, where he specializes in tenant and landlord representation. Maurice relies on his extensive market knowledge as well as his client-first approach to provide his clients with invaluable creative strategies and opportunistic solutions. Maurice is driven by his competitive nature, diligence and never-quit attitude. His clients appreciate his motivation, analytical skills, attention to detail and ability to understand both landlord and tenant perspectives. Maurice joined Newmark from Boston Properties, one of the largest real estate owners and developers in the United States, where he was responsible for assisting and overseeing in the operation and management of 3.3 million square feet.

brokerDetails.name: Karl Baldauf
brokerDetails.bio:
Karl Baldauf, an executive managing director with Newmark, specializes in office property leasing in the San Francisco central business district. With 32 years of experience in the industry, he has a unique perspective that reflects his successful careers in both traditional brokerage and with the significant San Francisco and national landlord, the Shorenstein Company. Closing more than 7.0 million square feet of transactions, Mr. Baldauf’s strengths are his natural leadership and teamwork skills and his depth of transaction experience in San Francisco’s high-rise market.

Mr. Baldauf’s real estate career began in 1987 at Damon Raike and Company, where he specialized in office leasing on both landlord and tenant representation assignments. From 1995 through 2005, he worked with the Shorenstein Company’s leasing team, and by 1999 he had moved into the role of senior vice president and regional manager of San Francisco properties. In this role, he was responsible for managing the San Francisco portfolio of more than 7.0 million square feet at 12 different properties.

In 2005 he joined the regional office of Cornish & Carey in San Francisco as a founding partner. He helped grow that office’s agency and tenant representation practices, culminating in the successful merger with Newmark in 2014.

brokerDetails.name: James Kilpatrick
brokerDetails.bio:
James Kilpatrick is the President of NAI Northern California. His career began in 1998 with a major national firm specializing in investment property brokerage where he received numerous achievement awards. He has been involved in investment transactions exceeding $1 Billion across most product categories and oversees the day to day operations, strategic expansion of the firm and large account management. 

Mr. Kilpatrick is a San Francisco Bay Area native with ownership, management, syndication and debt structuring experience across most product types. He has had various positions from board of directors appointments to President of various real estate organizations. He has also been a regular contributing writer for newsletters and trade journals of organizations such as the Berkeley Property Owners Association (BPOA) and RHA (Rental Housing Association of northern Alameda county). He is a member of the Rental Housing Owners Group (RHO), the Investment Marketing Forum (IMF) and Investment Property Marketing Group (IPMG). In addition to the above, Mr. Kilpatrick has experience in distressed asset sales, expert witness work, portfolio valuations, condominium and subdivision work, bankruptcy and trustee’s sales, sale leasebacks and other more complicated transactions.

brokerDetails.name: Seth Hubbert
brokerDetails.tagLine: Investment Advisor at NAI NorCal
brokerDetails.bio:
Seth is an Investment Advisor at NAI Northern California, specializing in transacting multifamily assets in the Bay Area. Seth has a strong leadership, analytical, and service background, providing the highest-level value to clients.

Seth has grown and led several successful businesses, including Five Iron Financial, a real estate investment firm renovating distressed property and operating housing in high-growth regions in the United States. He also previously served as the CEO of Tech Exchange, providing 45,000 computers to students and families during the height of the pandemic.

Holding degrees in Physics and Education, Seth masterfully blends quantitative analysis with client guidance and support. When not immersed in real estate, you’ll find Seth coaching youth sports, serving on community boards, and volunteering at his children’s school.

brokerDetails.name: Damon Gerstein
brokerDetails.tagLine: CRE investment professional based in Northern California.
brokerDetails.bio: Damon Gerstein specializes in office, multifamily, and industrial real estate across the Bay Area. Born and raised in Marin County, CA, Damon has spent his life immersed in the region’s unique communities and dynamic market. His local knowledge, combined with his academic background, provides clients with both insight and strategy in navigating complex transactions. Damon earned his Bachelor of Science in Urban and Regional Development with a minor in Real Estate Development from the University of Arizona. This foundation equips him with a deep understanding of market analysis, urban planning, and investment strategy—tools he leverages to deliver value to his clients. At NAI NorCal, Damon is committed to learning from industry leaders while actively contributing to the team’s success. Outside of real estate, he is passionate about traveling and sports, enjoying everything from working out and snowboarding to hiking and exploring the outdoors.

brokerDetails.name: James Kilpatrick
brokerDetails.bio:
James Kilpatrick is the President of NAI Northern California. His career began in 1998 with a major national firm specializing in investment property brokerage where he received numerous achievement awards. He has been involved in investment transactions exceeding $1 Billion across most product categories and oversees the day to day operations, strategic expansion of the firm and large account management. 

Mr. Kilpatrick is a San Francisco Bay Area native with ownership, management, syndication and debt structuring experience across most product types. He has had various positions from board of directors appointments to President of various real estate organizations. He has also been a regular contributing writer for newsletters and trade journals of organizations such as the Berkeley Property Owners Association (BPOA) and RHA (Rental Housing Association of northern Alameda county). He is a member of the Rental Housing Owners Group (RHO), the Investment Marketing Forum (IMF) and Investment Property Marketing Group (IPMG). In addition to the above, Mr. Kilpatrick has experience in distressed asset sales, expert witness work, portfolio valuations, condominium and subdivision work, bankruptcy and trustee’s sales, sale leasebacks and other more complicated transactions.

brokerDetails.name: Seth Hubbert
brokerDetails.tagLine: Investment Advisor at NAI NorCal
brokerDetails.bio:
Seth is an Investment Advisor at NAI Northern California, specializing in transacting multifamily assets in the Bay Area. Seth has a strong leadership, analytical, and service background, providing the highest-level value to clients.

Seth has grown and led several successful businesses, including Five Iron Financial, a real estate investment firm renovating distressed property and operating housing in high-growth regions in the United States. He also previously served as the CEO of Tech Exchange, providing 45,000 computers to students and families during the height of the pandemic.

Holding degrees in Physics and Education, Seth masterfully blends quantitative analysis with client guidance and support. When not immersed in real estate, you’ll find Seth coaching youth sports, serving on community boards, and volunteering at his children’s school.

brokerDetails.name: Damon Gerstein
brokerDetails.tagLine: CRE investment professional based in Northern California.
brokerDetails.bio: Damon Gerstein specializes in office, multifamily, and industrial real estate across the Bay Area. Born and raised in Marin County, CA, Damon has spent his life immersed in the region’s unique communities and dynamic market. His local knowledge, combined with his academic background, provides clients with both insight and strategy in navigating complex transactions. Damon earned his Bachelor of Science in Urban and Regional Development with a minor in Real Estate Development from the University of Arizona. This foundation equips him with a deep understanding of market analysis, urban planning, and investment strategy—tools he leverages to deliver value to his clients. At NAI NorCal, Damon is committed to learning from industry leaders while actively contributing to the team’s success. Outside of real estate, he is passionate about traveling and sports, enjoying everything from working out and snowboarding to hiking and exploring the outdoors.

brokerDetails.name: Kelly Glass
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in landlord agency and an award-winning Top Producer.
brokerDetails.bio:
Kelly Glass joined Avison Young in 2017 as a Principal. Kelly leads the leasing activity at Beacon Capital's high-quality 44 Montgomery Street office tower, which has approximately 700,000 square feet (sf).  In addition, she has leased 601 Montgomery, approximately 235,000 sf, on behalf of Montgomery Building Inc. for 21 years.  Most recently, Kelly was hired by Grosvenor to lease the four-building office portfolio in Union Square.

Kelly brings over 21 years of commercial real estate industry experience to Avison Young.  Previously, Kelly was a senior director at a top 5 CRE firm in San Francisco for 16 years. During her career, she has brokered leases spanning over 6.2 million sf while specializing in landlord representation within the downtown San Francisco office market. 

In 2022, Bisnow San Francisco announced Kelly as the recipient of the Bay Area Annual Women Leading Real Estate Award, for her influence as a Trailblazer in CRE.  In 2021, Kelly was recognized by GlobeSt.com as a Woman of Influence - Landlord/Agency Award. In 2019, Kelly achieved AY's Circle of Excellence Award.  In one of the most challenging markets, Kelly was ranked by Costar as one of San Francisco’s top 20 brokers in 2010, 2009 & 2008. In 2006, she was presented with C&W’s Service Excellence Award & in 2005 the Young Leader Award.  Kelly is consistently a Top 10 Producer for the NorCal region at Avison Young.

brokerDetails.name: Colton Hanley
brokerDetails.bio: Colton joined Avison Young's San Francisco office in June, 2019. Colton specializes in representing commercial landlords and tenants in office leasing transactions. Prior to joining Avison Young, Colton worked with CBRE’s Research Team where he contributed to San Francisco’s Market Research Reports and assisted real estate brokers in creating pitches and presentations for current and potential clients via detailed market analysis.

brokerDetails.name: Teva Myatt
brokerDetails.tagLine: Focused on Agency Leasing in Downtown San Francisco
brokerDetails.bio:
As a Leasing Associate, Teva’s responsibilities include marketing strategy, identifying prospective tenants, and negotiating rental terms on behalf of her clients. She maintains client relationships, conducts market analysis, and actively manages her property portfolio for maximum occupancy. Teva plays a crucial role in supporting clients and driving JLL’s success in the San Francisco market.

Teva has been with JLL since 2021 and a licensed broker since 2022. As young leader in the industry, Teva combines market and marketing intelligence with a thoughtful understanding of her clients’ goals to consistently achieve outstanding success in leasing properties.

Teva is a Bay Area native born and raised in Alamo, CA and currently resides in the Russian Hill neighborhood of San Francisco. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from California State University, Chico where she is an alumna of Alpha Delta Pi sorority. Teva is an active member of the Belden Club and regular volunteer with Girls on the Run.

brokerDetails.name: Margie Rogerson
brokerDetails.bio:
Ms. Rogerson's inspiration comes from her life time passion for color. Her search is for the perfect red ruby, the rare candy green emerald, and the special sapphire in blue or white or a rainbow of pastels. Mythological images from fairy tales and her own childhood fantasies mingle together to create her work. She says: "As a child I loved the thought of discovering a lost treasure chest filled with jewels." Many of her pieces are continuous strands of perfectly matching stones made into rings and bracelets. Her childhood's perspective of size and simplicity of design combine with intense flowing color creating a larger than life effect. The hand fabricated platinum gives the pieces their heavy sensuous feel.

Visit goldberry on-line at www.goldberry.com and by appointment in goldberry’s enchanting sunlit white marble and glass store at 3516 Sacramento Street in Presidio Heights in San Francisco. 800. 507.5505

Ms. Rogerson has donated to numerous charities including the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, the San Francisco Zoo, the Chinese American International School, the Asia Society, the French American International School, the GLAAD Media Awards, the Junior League of San Francisco and KQED. Her flair for design also extends to real estate where she creates innovative commercial property developments.

brokerDetails.name: Marquard Anderson II
brokerDetails.tagLine: Vice Chairman at Cushman & Wakefield
brokerDetails.bio:
Mark Anderson, a LEED accredited professional, joined Cushman & Wakefield in 2001 and specializes in representing tenants with the acquisition and disposition of their space in San Francisco and throughout the Bay Area.  He has consistently been a top producer in the San Francisco office and was ranked among the Top 100 producers nationally in 2011, 2013 and 2014.  Mr. Anderson’s 13 years of real estate practice results in more than 5 million sf of leases in San Francisco.

Additionally, Mr. Anderson is a founding member of the firm’s Young Leaders Group in Northern California.  Mr. Anderson is a graduate of Choate Rosemary Hall and the University of Colorado at Boulder where he earned a Bachelor of Science degree from the College of Business Administration with an emphasis in Marketing. He has participated in continuing education classes through UC Berkeley's Fisher Center for Real Estate and Urban Economics. Mr. Anderson is a member of The Olympic Club and Crystal Downs Country Club. He, his wife and two sons reside in San Francisco, CA.

brokerDetails.name: Scott Mason
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in San Francisco & Peninsula area commercial properties
brokerDetails.bio:
Scott founded Calco Commercial in 2011, and since has made Calco the #1 industrial real estate brokerage firm in San Francisco. Scott brings over 28 years of experience and 2,000+ transactions representing over $2+ Billion in sales and leases in the San Francisco & Peninsula area industrial and commercial real estate market places.

Specialty: Landlord and Tenant representation in the leasing and sales of commercial and industrial properties in San Francisco. Scott is consistently ranked the #1 Industrial Broker in San Francisco.

brokerDetails.name: Marc Pope
brokerDetails.bio: As a Vice Chairman in Cushman & Wakefield’s Burlingame office, Marc Pope has over 12 years of experience representing tenants throughout the San Francisco Peninsula. Marc Pope specializes in tenant representation, focusing on life science clients and the complex needs of small start-ups, fast growth companies, and large pharma clients. Marc sits on the executive board for Cushman & Wakefield’s Life Science Advisory Group, a nationwide team that aligns resources and creates strategies for its clients across multiple markets and is Cushman & Wakefield’s Northern California life science lead. Since joining Cushman & Wakefield, he has consistently been a top producer with consideration close to $1.6B over the past 2 years.

brokerDetails.name: Gary Boitano
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in Landlord and Tenant representation for Industrial and R&D.
brokerDetails.bio:
Having worked in finance and growing up in the Bay Area, Gary brings a unique and acute sensibility for the region’s always changing market. This background enables him to provide a very methodical and analytical service to his clients. 

Gary received a Bachelor’s Degree in Economics from Santa Clara University and is also an active member of the university’s Alumni Association Board of Directors. Gary also studied abroad while at the collegiate level at Syracuse University in Florence, Italy.

brokerDetails.name: Evan Housel
brokerDetails.tagLine: Evan Housel is a senior vice president at Kidder Mathews with a primary client focus in the San Francisco market.
brokerDetails.bio:
As a licensed broker with 15 years’ experience in the industry and over 800 career transactions completed, Evan has worked unwaveringly to establish himself as a top producing, client focused broker in the San Francisco market. His multi-faceted approach representing both tenants and landlords affords him creative insight into assembling complex lease transactions and investment sales.

As a tenant advisor, Evan has guided multiple, household name technology companies from the early stages through multiple rounds of growth requiring significant strategic expansions, headcount planning, space planning and sublease dispositions while mitigating exposure to unforeseen facilities costs. With multiple case studies to demonstrate his expertise, it becomes evident why clients of Evan remain loyal to him as integral advisor in the San Francisco market.

On the landlord side, Evan has developed a name as the go to advisor for creative office and flex space work environments. With the demand for creative work environments at an all-time high, Evan has guided numerous landlords through alterations as simple as light renovations to full-scale redevelopments, allowing landlords to create some of the most unique, creative work environments in San Francisco while maximizing their returns by catering to the tastes of a very discerning market. His advisory role as a landlord representative affords his loyal landlord clients the ability to capitalize on their assets and ensure long-term profitability through sound guidance supported by multiple, verifiable case studies.

In summary Evan’s multi-faceted approach to brokerage gives his clients a unique advantage to understanding the multiple factors that go into a successful transaction through his experience on both sides of the negotiation table. Evan is always happy to take the time to provide case studies, site visits and client references to potential future clients.

brokerDetails.name: Kevin Pon
brokerDetails.bio:
Kevin Pon is a real estate professional in the San Francisco Bay Area, specializing in net lease and retail investment properties. Kevin focuses on his clients’ best interests and guides them toward achieving their short and long term goals. With nearly 18 years of exceptional sales experience, he has a proven track record of success delivering outstanding results and cultivating long lasting relationships.

Prior to entering real estate brokerage, Kevin led sales teams at LoopNet, Costar (post-acquisition of Loopnet), LendingClub, and Side Real Estate. When not making cold calls and working on deals, he enjoys spending time with his young daughter, exploring outdoors, and rooting for the 49ers and Warriors.

brokerDetails.name: Charlie Cutler
brokerDetails.tagLine: Charlie has been advising some of California’s leading companies in commercial real estate.
brokerDetails.bio:
Charlie, born and raised in San Francisco, attended UC Berkeley as a scholarship athlete where he was drafted by the St Louis Cardinals. As a Catcher, Charlie played pro baseball for nearly a decade with the Cardinals, Pirates, Cubs, and Angels.

Charlie Cutler started working in commercial real estate after retiring from baseball and moving back to the Bay Area. He has worked alongside some of the best athletes in the world and brings the same level of attention and intensity to his work with his clients in real estate. Charlie is an expert at leveraging his local knowledge against long-standing relationships to showcase new spaces even before they hit the market.

Charlie advises California’s leading companies and national multi-market clients in commercial real estate but also gives passionate attention and service to all his start-up clients. He has earned the trust of a loyal clientele by consistently providing thoughtful and creative solutions on high-value real estate projects. Charlie specializes in strategic planning, negotiations, transaction structuring, sales & leases, build-to-suit guidance, and project team leadership.

Charlie and his wife have an eight-year-old daughter named Chloe and a four-year-old son named Cal. On the weekends, he loves to spend time with his family and enjoying outdoor activities; fishing, diving, backpacking, kayaking, biking, surfing, and hiking.

brokerDetails.name: Bennett Faloni
brokerDetails.tagLine: Bennett Faloni serves as an Associate Advisor with Calco Commercial, Inc.
brokerDetails.bio:
Bennett Faloni joins Calco as a specialist in industrial sales, leasing, and tenant representation, bringing his experience from Pittsburgh, PA. Bennett’s approach is built around people, adapting to each individual’s unique needs. Whether it’s picking up the phone or meeting clients face-to-face, Bennett prioritizes personal connections and tailors his strategies to fit each client’s goals.
 
Packing up and moving across the country to be part of the region’s dynamic market was a move that Bennett was ready for. Bennett began his commercial real estate career at SVN, where he quickly gained experience working with a wide range of clients—from local mom-and-pop businesses with just two employees, to national energy solutions providers. He’s worked across diverse property types, from 200,000-square-foot heavy industrial buildings to 500-square-foot office suites.
 
This broad experience has helped Bennett stay nimble and adaptable, allowing him to focus on what matters most in every deal: understanding the decision maker’s definition of “success.” His ability to connect with clients, understand their goals, and find creative solutions is at the core of his achievements.
 
Outside of work, Bennett enjoys improvising on the piano, exploring the food and cocktail scene in San Francisco, and traveling the world to discover new cultures. His natural curiosity fuels both his personal and professional life, driving him to explore new opportunities and create meaningful connections wherever he goes.

brokerDetails.name: Mark Geisreiter
brokerDetails.bio:
Mark Geisreiter has been responsible for the leasing and acquisition of more than 50 million square feet of buildings in Northern California. He has completed many of the Bay Area’s signature transactions, including the largest lease transaction in San Francisco history, signing Dropbox for 736,000 square feet at The Exchange and the second largest land sale in San Francisco history representing Recology in the sale of 6.3 acres to Amazon for $202M. Mark also played a key role in the largest merger in REIT history when Equity Office Properties acquired Spieker Properties. A frequently quoted industry expert, Mark has been a broker and developer and has held senior leadership roles for some of the most prestigious companies in the real estate industry.

Mark began his commercial real estate career in 1985 with CBRE in San Francisco. He spent 12 years with the firm, consistently ranking among its top producers both locally and nationally. Mark joined Equity Office Properties in 1997 where he was responsible for the leasing, financial and operating performance of a 22 million-square-foot office portfolio comprising 217 buildings with a combined value in excess of $10 billion. Upon the sale of EOP, Mark became a partner with Panattoni Development Company and led its expansion efforts in the Bay Area. Mark joined San Francisco’s most prominent boutique brokerage firm, The CAC Group in 2009 and was reunited with CBRE upon CBRE’s acquisition of The CAC Group in 2014. Recruited to Newmark in 2019, Mark now leads Newmark’s Bay Area Private Capital Group which has the top market share in the sale of office and industrial assets for private owners in the Bay Area.

brokerDetails.name: David Fuette

brokerDetails.name: Bart O'Connor
brokerDetails.bio:
Bart O’Connor specializes in office property leasing and sales in the San Francisco Central Business District. Bart has a diversified background as an accomplished broker and respected project team member. Formerly with Hines, an internationally recognized development firm, Bart was responsible for assisting in the management, operations, and leasing programs of office developments in several major cities in the Western United States.

Bart joined Hines Interests (Hines) in 1993, as part of its West Region Management Team and worked in Seattle, San Diego and Los Angeles before transferring to Hines West Region headquarters in San Francisco. Bart joined CBRE in 1998 and recognized as Top Five Producers in San Francisco from 1998 through 2003 as well as CBRE Top Producers nationally. Bart was a founding partner of the San Francisco office of Newmark. And managing partner of the San Francisco office from 2007 to 2011, successfully ushering the office through the 2008-2009 economic downturns.

description:
Nestled within San Francisco’s coveted Jordan Park neighborhood, 3400-3420 Geary Blvd stands as a meticulously maintained three-story commercial edifice. Its prime location at the intersection of Geary Blvd and Commonwealth Avenue places it amidst the bustling retail arteries, boasting an array of popular restaurants, coffee and boba tea shops, bars, and retail outlets. Just a stone’s throw away lies the main campus of the University of San Francisco, while Presidio Park and Golden Gate Park offer nearby escapes into nature. Public transit options abound, ensuring effortless connectivity.
Spanning 20,515 square feet according to architectural measurements, this landmark building occupies an expansive 11,000 square-foot lot, as per tax records. Comprising eight retail units and forty offices, the property bears the APN 1063-019 designation and falls under NC3 zoning.
A discerning eye may recognize the potential for a residential conversion—a prospect worth exploring in consultation with architects and legal advisors.
Positioned as an enticing investment opportunity, this property beckons professional investors and owner-users alike to stake their claim in the vibrant tapestry of San Francisco life.

description:
Touchstone Commercial Partners, Inc. is pleased to offer investors the opportunity to purchase the fee simple interest in the mixed use building at 1183-1185 Howard Street, San Francisco, CA 94103.

1183-1885 Howard Street is a two story, approximately 5,260 square foot, building located on approximately 2,250 square feet of land. The ground floor is a renovated commercial unit with private outdoor patio, while the top floor is a renovated residential apartment, comprised of three (3) bedrooms, two (2) bathrooms, a dining room, living room and ample living space.

The property is situated on Howard Street between 7th & 8th Street, close to BART, freeways and many other neighborhood shops and restaurants. The entire property will be delivered vacant at the close of escrow, making this an ideal owner/user building or investment opportunity in one of San Francisco’s most desirable locations.

description: 1380 48th Avenue presents a rare investment opportunity in San Franciscos desirable Outer Sunset neighborhood. This 8-unit multifamily property consists of approximately 5,760 sq ft of rentable space on a 6,000 sq ft lot, built in 1975 and well-positioned for long-term cash flow and appreciation. The unit mix includes six spacious 1-bedroom units and two 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom unitsa configuration that appeals to a wide tenant base. All units offer generous floor plans and excellent natural light. The building is meticulously maintained and reflects true pride of ownership, with stable tenancy and strong current income, with upside potential. Each unit is assigned one parking space (8 total), and there is a shared laundry facility on-site for added convenience and operational efficiency. Located just one block from Ocean Beach, and minutes from Golden Gate Park and the Judah Street retail corridor, the property benefits from strong tenant demand in a high-barrier-to-entry submarket with low vacancy rates. This is an ideal asset for investors seeking stable returns and long-term growth.

description: The property at 1055 Pine Street is a historic multi-family apartment building located in the vibrant Lower Nob Hill neighborhood of San Francisco. Initially constructed in 1910, it spans 5 stories and approximately 36,213 square feet. The building features 80 units, primarily studios and one-bedrooms, historically used as affordable student housing. It includes 24 bathrooms and is zoned RM-4 (Residential Mixed, High Density), allowing for high-density residential use with potential for mixed commercial elements on the ground floor.
investmentHighlights: Vacancy: Citywide vacancies have fallen to ~4.5%, with Nob Hill rents up 5-7% YoY.
Prime Value-Add Opportunity: Vacant building ripe for repositioning through modern renovations to capture premium rents.
Call Jim Wright for more information.
Median rent across unit types is $3,047 but Nob Hill skews higher at $3,500-$4,375 for studios/1-beds ideal for student or young professional tenants.
Well Below Replacement Cost: Acquisition below replacement cost ensures strategic advantage and strong demand.

brokerDetails.name: Christopher Roeder
brokerDetails.tagLine: Vice Chairman for JLL with over 20 years of experience with Bay Area commercial real estate.
brokerDetails.bio:
Chris is a corporate real estate advisor who leads the 45+ person brokerage team at JLL in San Francisco. He primarily represents institutional landlords and tenants throughout the city’s 90 million square foot commercial office sector.

Since joining the firm in 2007, Chris has consistently been considered and awarded as one of the top brokers in the United States. He has over 25 years of experience with devising strategic leasing plans for San Francisco’s largest and most active institutional investors, helping create new submarkets such as Mid-Market, The Presidio and SOMA, and executing some of the largest and most complicated transactions over the last 2 decades in San Francisco.

Chris is consistently recognized for his expertise in commercial real estate advisory and transaction execution and was recently awarded the Champion of Excellence award by JLL for his lifetime achievements.

Chris is a San Francisco Bay Area native and lives in Marin County with his wife Stephanie, son Jack (14) and daughter Emerson (11). He loves the San Francisco Giants and 49ers, the Golden State Warriors, enjoys ski weekends with his family at Squaw Valley, attempting to play golf at the Meadow Club, and hiking and biking Mount Tamalpais.

brokerDetails.name: Matt Shewey
brokerDetails.tagLine: Matt Shewey is a Senior Managing Director at JLL with over 20 years of experience in real estate.
brokerDetails.bio: Matt Shewey specializes in representing institutional landlords with the acquisition, leasing and disposition of their office portfolio in San Francisco and throughout the Bay Area. Over his 20 year career, Matt has leased or sold over 15 million square feet with a consideration of over $5.8 billion. Matt works with several of the top institutional landlords in the country and has represented some of the most prolific buildings in San Francisco. Most notably, he leases the Transamerica Pyramid, a trophy asset and one of the most recognizable buildings in the world.

brokerDetails.name: Carlye Parker
brokerDetails.tagLine: Carlye Parker joined JLL in 2019 as a member of JLL’s Landlord Representation Team in San Francisco.
brokerDetails.bio: Carlye Parker joined JLL in 2019 as a member of JLL’s Landlord Representation Team in San Francisco. She and her team have negotiated leases for a range of major institutionally-owned, Class A office buildings in the San Francisco Bay Area. Carlye has a strong interest and vast experience in development and re-development projects and has implemented several unique asset strategy programs. A few of her recent noteworthy projects include the redevelopment of the iconic Transamerica Pyramid Center and successfully leasing up the entirety of the Letterman Digital Arts Center, which was 100% leased as of late 2021. Carlye has a passion for complex projects and attention to detail, which she mastered in her previous roll with Adobe Systems, where she was strategically planning & implementing international marketing and events programs.

brokerDetails.name: Lexi Castellino
brokerDetails.tagLine: Lexi's main focus is managing leasing activity reports and financial analyses.
brokerDetails.bio:
Lexi Castellino joined JLL in 2023, and works primarily with their Landlord Representation Team in San Francisco. Her main focus is managing leasing activity reports and financial analyses, perfecting the Art of the Tour specific to each project, networking with the brokerage community, driving awareness and excitement about her listings, and increasing tour activity. 

Lexi is a native Californian, born and raised in Hillsborough. She is an active Alumni in both her major and Sorority, Kappa Alpha Theta. Lexi interned in the JLL San Francisco office during college, prior to joining full-time following graduation. 

Lexi currently lives in San Francisco, CA. She is a member of the Beldon Club & actively participates in CoreNet events. Outside of the office she enjoys going to Pilates, wine tasting, spending time with her friends and family, and exploring all that San Francisco and the greater Bay Area has to offer.

description:
An exceptional investment opportunity awaits with this remarkable grand-scale Victorian mixed-use property. Situated in the heart of San Francisco's vibrant Mission District, this unique and impressive property offers a fusion of history and charm with strong income.

Currently at full occupancy with a blend of commercial and residential tenants, this sprawling property spans over 10,000 square feet, comprised of a semi-detached structure on a generously sized lot.

Diverse and robust income streams are a hallmark of this investment, boasting a varied portfolio of tenants. The residential units showcase exquisite architectural details, high ceilings, and spacious kitchens that flow onto decks overlooking the lush, tropical garden.

The commercial units share the same grand scale, featuring high ceilings and abundant space, perfectly suited for a range of uses such as retail, office space, or creative work environments. Beyond the property's walls, the Mission District offers a captivating array of attractions. Enjoy a thriving restaurant and bar scene, discover unique small businesses, and relish in the vibrant ambiance of Dolores Park. Seamlessly connect to the city's heartbeat with easy access to the Muni Metro and BART, making commuting a breeze.

With its storied past and urban appeal, this investment gem has consistently ranked high on the list of sought-after locations for both residential and commercial ventures. Don't miss out on the chance to make it yours!

description:
NAI Northern California is pleased to present the Redstone Building (once known as the San Francisco Labor Temple) at 2924-2948 16th Street, an iconic steel-framed, three-story, low-rise office boasting a total building area of 55,560 square feet. Presenting significant rent upside, with current in-place rents averaging $22 per square foot compared to market rates of $39 per square foot, this offering has strong income growth potential through renewals and tenant turnover. Additional value can be unlocked through the unfinished 8,690-square-foot basement, which a future owner may improve for further income generation. At an offering price of just $193 per square foot, this is a rare opportunity to acquire a fully leased Mission District asset at a compelling value relative to comparable improved properties.
        
The Redstone Building is rich in history and filled with character and charm, showcased by its brick masonry and concrete exterior facade. Highly visible, this building features street frontage along both 16th Street and Capp Street. Current tenants include small offices, community organizations, artists and art spaces, event and performance spaces, and a church. Restoration efforts have revitalized The Redstone Building into a vibrant, modern workspace, positioning new ownership to benefit from a stabilized asset with continued upside potential.
      
The property has undergone extensive upgrades and improvements across multiple areas. Interior enhancements include the clearing of five former theater units, one of which had seating and theatre aesthetics preserved, while vacant spaces received new flooring, lighting, plumbing fixtures, and paint. Outdated wall heaters were replaced with modern, energy-efficient models. Building systems and common areas have also been updated with a modernized elevator, new plumbing fixtures, shut-off valves, motion-sensor LED lighting, and fresh paint. Rest assured, the building's historic murals have been meticulously preserved. Security and access have been elevated with the installation of cameras on every floor, app-based and code-entry systems for units and common areas, and the replacement of the rear gate and fencing. Structural upgrades include comprehensive basement waterproofing and drainage improvements, along with the installation of new sump pumps.
       
The Redstone Building, located in the Mission District, a buzzing and desirable neighborhood in San Francisco, is home to a population of 47,205 and offers an intersection of vibrant culture and socioeconomic diversity. Serving as a Latino cultural hub, the Mission is home to many restaurants, boutiques, and a rich art scene that includes the largest collection of murals in the city. Geographically, the Mission is part of the Eastern Neighborhoods along with SoMa, Showplace Square/Potrero Hill, and Central Waterfront.

Structural upgrades include comprehensive basement waterproofing and drainage improvements, along with the installation of new sump pumps.
       
The Redstone Building, located in the Mission District, a buzzing and desirable neighborhood in San Francisco, is home to a population of 47,205 and offers an intersection of vibrant culture and socioeconomic diversity. Serving as a Latino cultural hub, the Mission is home to many restaurants, boutiques, and a rich art scene that includes the largest collection of murals in the city. Geographically, the Mission is part of the Eastern Neighborhoods along with SoMa, Showplace Square/Potrero Hill, and Central Waterfront.
highlights: Fully Leased: Occupancy has grown from 26% to 100% in under two years, driven by hands-on ownership, strategic renovations, and leasing execution.

Walkable Mission District Location: One block from BART and surrounded by local institutions, celebrated restaurants, and creative businesses.
Landmark Architecture: Historic 1914 red-brick building with a 1939 addition, arched windows, decorative cornices, and intricate plaster details.

brokerDetails.name: James Kilpatrick
brokerDetails.bio:
James Kilpatrick is the President of NAI Northern California. His career began in 1998 with a major national firm specializing in investment property brokerage where he received numerous achievement awards. He has been involved in investment transactions exceeding $1 Billion across most product categories and oversees the day to day operations, strategic expansion of the firm and large account management. 

Mr. Kilpatrick is a San Francisco Bay Area native with ownership, management, syndication and debt structuring experience across most product types. He has had various positions from board of directors appointments to President of various real estate organizations. He has also been a regular contributing writer for newsletters and trade journals of organizations such as the Berkeley Property Owners Association (BPOA) and RHA (Rental Housing Association of northern Alameda county). He is a member of the Rental Housing Owners Group (RHO), the Investment Marketing Forum (IMF) and Investment Property Marketing Group (IPMG). In addition to the above, Mr. Kilpatrick has experience in distressed asset sales, expert witness work, portfolio valuations, condominium and subdivision work, bankruptcy and trustee’s sales, sale leasebacks and other more complicated transactions.

brokerDetails.name: Seth Hubbert
brokerDetails.tagLine: Investment Advisor at NAI NorCal
brokerDetails.bio:
Seth is an Investment Advisor at NAI Northern California, specializing in transacting multifamily assets in the Bay Area. Seth has a strong leadership, analytical, and service background, providing the highest-level value to clients.

Seth has grown and led several successful businesses, including Five Iron Financial, a real estate investment firm renovating distressed property and operating housing in high-growth regions in the United States. He also previously served as the CEO of Tech Exchange, providing 45,000 computers to students and families during the height of the pandemic.

Holding degrees in Physics and Education, Seth masterfully blends quantitative analysis with client guidance and support. When not immersed in real estate, you’ll find Seth coaching youth sports, serving on community boards, and volunteering at his children’s school.

brokerDetails.name: Damon Gerstein
brokerDetails.tagLine: CRE investment professional based in Northern California.
brokerDetails.bio: Damon Gerstein specializes in office, multifamily, and industrial real estate across the Bay Area. Born and raised in Marin County, CA, Damon has spent his life immersed in the region’s unique communities and dynamic market. His local knowledge, combined with his academic background, provides clients with both insight and strategy in navigating complex transactions. Damon earned his Bachelor of Science in Urban and Regional Development with a minor in Real Estate Development from the University of Arizona. This foundation equips him with a deep understanding of market analysis, urban planning, and investment strategy—tools he leverages to deliver value to his clients. At NAI NorCal, Damon is committed to learning from industry leaders while actively contributing to the team’s success. Outside of real estate, he is passionate about traveling and sports, enjoying everything from working out and snowboarding to hiking and exploring the outdoors.

brokerDetails.name: Tim Marshall
brokerDetails.tagLine: Investment advisor with expertise in property management, operations, and client service, helping clients maximize real estate investments.
brokerDetails.bio:
Investment Advisor with a background in property management, operations, and client service. As founder of Marpensio LLC, Tim oversaw all aspects of property management including asset performance, tenant relations, leasing, and vendor coordination. Previous roles in operations and customer experience strengthened his leadership, process improvement, and client service skills.

Tim now applies this combined expertise to advising clients on commercial real estate investments. By leveraging market research and data-driven insights, he helps clients evaluate opportunities, maximize asset performance, and achieve long-term investment success with a client-first approach.

description:
A rare opportunity to acquire a classic San Francisco mixed-use investment property combining stable, in-place income with clear upside potential. 

Located in the heart of Duboce Triangle, one of the city’s most walkable and desirable neighborhoods, the property features four fully leased residential units and two prominent street-front commercial spaces — offering investors both immediate cash flow and long-term growth.

The surrounding neighborhood is home to a highly educated, professional demographic with strong income levels, active lifestyles, and consistent demand for quality housing and local services. Exceptional walkability and connectivity via MUNI Metro and the historic F-Market streetcar make Duboce Triangle one of San Francisco’s most livable and enduring investment submarkets.

This well-maintained Edwardian property offers a compelling balance of character, stability, and value-add potential — an ideal acquisition for private investors and 1031 exchange buyers seeking durable income and long-term appreciation in one of the city’s most proven markets.

Prime mixed-use investment in San Francisco’s Duboce Triangle. This well-maintained Edwardian features four leased residential units and two street-front commercial spaces with strong income and future upside. Situated between Duboce Triangle and the Castro District, one of the city’s most walkable, vibrant areas with cafés, boutiques, and steady foot traffic. The neighborhood attracts professional tenants and supports consistent rent growth. Excellent transit via F-Market and J-Church lines connects directly to Civic Center, Union Square, and FiDi. A rare, stable investment ideal for cash flow, appreciation, or a 1031 exchange.
