spaces.name: 1st Floor
spaces.description:
$0.50/sf STARTING RENT

Industrial Space for Lease - Zoned PDR-1 & PDR-2 in San Francisco, CA

This expansive industrial space, located in the Bayview Neighborhood of San Francisco, is available for lease and offers a unique opportunity for businesses requiring flexible zoning, with both PDR-1 and PDR-2 designations. Spanning up to 13,096 square feet, the space is ideal for a variety of uses, including manufacturing, production, research and development, and light industrial activities.

Key Features:
Zoning: PDR-1 and PDR-2 — Suitable for a range of light industrial, tech, creative, and maker businesses. PDR-1 allows for a variety of light industrial uses, while PDR-2 offers further flexibility for larger-scale production, innovation labs, and design studios.

Location: Situated in a prime industrial district of San Francisco, offering easy access to major highways (I-280, US-101) and public transportation. This location is well-connected to the city's tech hub, SOMA, and is within proximity to the Bay Area's business districts.

Space Configuration: The unit features a spacious open floor plan with high ceilings (up to 18 feet), large industrial-grade windows providing ample natural light, and wide access points suitable for loading docks and vehicle maneuvering.

Utilities & Amenities: The property is equipped with 3-phase power, heavy-duty electrical infrastructure, ample water supply, and high-speed internet options. The building also includes a common entryway lobby, along with dedicated restroom facilities.

Access & Parking: The space offers 24/7 access with secure entry and a street parking for employees and delivery trucks. On-site loading docks facilitate smooth logistics and shipment processes.

Flexibility: The property’s zoning allows for a variety of uses including light manufacturing, fabrication, tech startups, and creative studios. The open layout allows for customization to meet your business’s specific needs.

This location is a rare find in the city’s industrial sector, offering businesses both the flexibility of PDR-1 and PDR-2 zoning as well as an unbeatable location with access to all of San Francisco’s major thoroughfares. Whether you're in need of a production facility, office space for R&D, or a hybrid of both, this space can accommodate your needs.

description:
A uniquely positioned commercial asset in the heart of San Francisco’s Lower Nob Hill, 729 Bush Street blends historic charm with modern versatility. This distinguished two-story building—with a full basement—spans approximately 5,500 sq. ft. on a rare 3,781-sq.-ft. lot. Zoned RC-4, it accommodates a wide array of commercial uses, from boutique showroom and creative offices to medical suites or specialized retail.

Steeped in the character of San Francisco’s early 20th-century architecture, the property reflects the city’s enduring cultural fabric bridging the elegance of the past with the momentum of its evolving urban core. Just blocks from Union Square and the Financial District, and easily accessible via BART, MUNI, and historic cable cars, the location offers exceptional visibility and foot traffic.

Recent redevelopment studies highlight the property’s forward-looking potential, from vertical expansion opportunities to modern medical or mixed-use build-outs. For investors or tenants seeking a presence that embodies both legacy and opportunity, 729 Bush Street stands as a timeless cornerstone in one of San Francisco’s most vibrant commercial districts.

description: 924 Fulton Street is a beautiful 1927 apartment building near the corner of Fillmore Street in the much sought after Alamo Square Neighborhood of San Francisco. The building consists of 23 total units including (1) two-bedroom/two bath unit, (4) one-bedroom/two bath units, (11) one-bedroom/one bath units and (7) junior one-bedroom/one bath units. The units are very well sized with ample natural light and good closet space; some have huge walk-in closets in bedrooms and hallways. Approximately half of the units have been upgraded over the last 5 years and have a mix of hardwood and carpeted floors. The upper level units have wonderful cityscape views. Many of the one bedroom units have potential for conversion to two bedrooms. The garage level consists of 9 car parking spaces, owner/RM storage rooms, and 2 coin operated washers and 3 coin operated dryers, all building owned. Heat is provided by electric baseboard or wall heaters and all the units are separately metered for PG&E. Owner is responsible for water and trash. Tenants pay for electricity and heat in the units. Elevator was refurbished in 2024 and the roof was replaced in 2006. The electrical has been upgraded from the original fuses. 924 Fulton presents a fantastic opportunity for the astute San Francisco investor!

lotDetails.description:
Positioned in the heart of San Francisco’s vibrant Outer Sunset/Parkside corridor, 2143–2145 Taraval Street presents a rare leasing opportunity ideal for healthcare, wellness, or retail operators. Formerly a veterinary clinic, this thoughtfully configured space offers a turnkey layout that includes multiple exam and treatment rooms, a welcoming reception area, private office, and built-in plumbing infrastructure—making it especially well-suited for medical, dental, chiropractic, or physical therapy practices.
The property benefits from excellent street frontage and signage visibility along bustling Taraval Street, a key commercial artery lined with neighborhood-serving businesses and strong pedestrian activity. Just steps from the Muni L Taraval line and surrounded by a dense residential population, the location offers both convenience and high exposure. The space is adaptable and may be subdivided to accommodate smaller users, offering flexibility for a range of tenant needs.

description:
Marcus & Millichap is pleased to present 190 27th Avenue, a beautifully maintained six-unit apartment building located in the prestigious Sea Cliff neighborhood of San Francisco, California.

Set on a 3,250 square foot lot, the property was originally constructed in 1921 and encompasses approximately 7,425 square feet of living area. The building offers a desirable mix of one- and two-bedroom floor plans, each featuring elegant formal living and dining rooms that capture the timeless charm of early 20th-century architecture. Recent capital expenditures include a brand new roof, new 400 amp main and electrical sub panels, seismic retrofit, and high end unit upgrades. Residents benefit from amenities including four (4) private garage parking spaces, on-site laundry, in-unit laundry in select units, and dedicated storage spaces.

Ideally positioned near Lincoln Park Golf Course, China Beach, the Presidio, and the shops and restaurants along California Street, 190 27th Avenue provides tenants with an exceptional combination of comfort, character, and proximity to some of San Francisco’s most iconic destinations.

description:
565 Geary Street is a prominent six-story mixed-use apartment building located in the heart of San Francisco’s Downtown district, just two and a half blocks from Union Square. The property includes 61 residential units, three ground-floor retail units, five office suites, and a 21-car valet parking garage on two parcels, one of which includes the adjacent lot at 549 Shannon Alley. The unit mix consists of 40 studios, 7 junior one bedrooms, 12 one-bedrooms, one two-bedroom penthouse, and one upsized three-bedroom two-bath unit—created by expanding into a former office space.

The building has undergone significant capital improvements in recent years. Most notably, the elevator was completely rebuilt at a cost of $400,000, and a new fire horn system was installed. The roof was replaced approximately five years ago with a modified bitumen system. Interior improvements include new carpet throughout, upgraded lighting, new mailboxes, and other cosmetic updates that enhance both functionality and tenant experience. The building is heated by a steam boiler system and includes three coin-operated washers and dryers in the common laundry area.

Utilities are separately metered for gas but master metered for electricity, with a 800-amp main. The parking garage is metered separately for water and is leased to a third-party operator, who reports strong demand f rom delivery services and daily parkers.

Approximately 10% of the residential units have undergone full remodels, while about 30% have updated bathrooms and another 10% feature remodeled kitchens. The building is professionally managed, with all tenants currently paying rent and no non-performing occupants. Offered at $9,850,000, the property represents a 6.6% cap rate and provides strong in-place income with significant upside through continued unit turnover and modernization. Located in one of the city’s most vibrant and culturally rich neighborhoods, 565 Geary offers investors a rare opportunity to acquire a stabilized, cash-flowing asset with long-term value in a core San Francisco location.

description:
833 Corbett Avenue is a rare 5-unit investment opportunity in San Francisco's iconic Twin Peaks neighborhood. This impeccably maintained property features a diverse unit mix: one 3-bedroom/2-bath, one 2-bedroom/2-bath, one 2-bedroom/1-bath, and two 1-bedroom/1-bath. Unit 1 spans two levels with a house-like layout and 2 bathrooms. Unit 5 is also a generous two-level 2-bedroom residence. Every apartment captures sweeping panoramic views of San Francisco, from Downtown and through the Bay looking south. Each unit also includes private outdoor space for residents to enjoy the city skyline. The building's distinctive design cascades from Corbett Avenue down to a secondary frontage on Market Street. There is a 5-car garage providing parking for the tenant's convenience.

Utilities are separately metered, with tenants paying for gas, electric, and heat, keeping operating expenses minimal. The soft-story seismic retrofit was completed in 2019. The property shows the pride of ownership throughout, offering a solid investment with over 30% rental upside. This is an excellent opportunity to
acquire a turn-key building with amazing views in one of San Francisco's most sought-after locations.

description: Introducing an iconic property with a storied history, the building at 2275 California St, San Francisco, CA, 94115 presents a compelling investment opportunity for a multifamily investor or prospective owner-occupier. Built in 1900 and boasting 6,000 SF situated on a 3,438 square foot lot, this RH2-zoned property comprises three units, exuding timeless architectural details and historic charm. With one-third of the units occupied, this well-maintained building offers a prospective owner-user or investor two (2) vacant units for owner move-in or the opportunity to rent out units at market rents immediately including a massive 4-bedroom / 2-bath, 2-story owner's unit. Its prime location in lower Pacific Heights adds to its allure, making it a reliable and sought-after investment in the revitalized San Francisco real estate market.
investmentHighlights: Rare 3-unit triplex with two (2) massive units delivered vacant: (1) 2bd/1.5ba, and one (1) 2-story 4bd/2ba owner's unit
Large backyard & garden, two (2) large storage rooms, washer / dryers dedicated to each unit
Lots of natural light with full directional views
Prime location in Lower Pacific Heights, 2 blocks from upper Fillmore St dining, shopping & retail
Massive upside for an investor with 2/3 units delivered vacant

description: Great opportunity to own this unique Warehouse/ Loft NC-2 Zoning building. it consists of 3 levels which all enjoy an unobstructed view of the water next to the new $200 million India Basin Waterfront park. The top floor apartment has 6 large sky lights with abundant natural light and panoramic views of the bay. A large living space with a fully equipped open kitchen, full bathroom, 2 bedrooms plus a study room and a TV room.  The warehouse roll up door provides access to the street level with open bay skylights in front, 2 full bathrooms one of them is unwarranted, w/d hookups room, large open space. The lower level has several rooms, water views and a large storage area.  There is also an open hatch to access the sub-area of the building. You will find approved but expired plans to build multiple residential units, blueprints available with the disclosure packet. new 2019 Bitumen roof.

spaces.description: Prime Mission District retail opportunity featuring 807 SF of ground floor space plus 340 SF basement storage. Former liquor store located between Mission and Valencia corridors with excellent storefront visibility and strong pedestrian traffic. Existing glass refrigeration equipment remains in the space and appears to be in good condition, making it ideal for grocery, convenience, or liquor store operators. Zoned NC-3, allowing a variety of retail and service uses, including specialty food, personal services, boutique retail, neighborhood-serving shops, or a coin laundry operator. One block from Cesar Chavez Street with direct Highway 101 access, and a short walk to 24th Street Mission BART and multiple Muni lines. Walk Score 99 | Transit 86 | Bike 98. Lease is negotiable at $42.00/SF/year. Vacant and ready for tenant improvements.
